noun.description: A familiar or humorous name given to a person or thing instead of or as well as the real name.

verb.description: Give a nickname to; call by a nickname.
examples: his fraternity brothers nicknamed him “The Bird” because of his skydiving skills

origin: Late Middle English: from an eke-name ( eke meaning addition: see eke), misinterpreted, by wrong division, as a neke name.
